review.summary: This is a clean, minimal __init__.py file for the events infrastructure layer. It properly exports three infrastructure components (repository, publisher, processor) following the Maximum Separation Architecture pattern. The file is well-documented and follows neo-commons conventions.

positive_observations.observation: Clear module docstring explaining purpose and architectural alignment
Explicit __all__ list providing clean public API control
Follows neo-commons naming conventions (class names match file purposes)
Proper separation of concerns - repository, publisher, and processor as distinct modules
Uses relative imports appropriate for feature-based organization
Concise and focused - exactly what an infrastructure init file should be

context.tests: No tests required - this is a simple module aggregator
context.documentation: Well documented with clear module docstring
context.configuration: No configuration needed - pure module export
